intro: Navarretia longiflora, commonly known as the long-flowered navarretia, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in early spring. Navarretia longiflora is known for its delicate appearance and is often found in clusters along the ground.
